definition: knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]

sentences.english: An offended brother is more unyielding than a fortified city.
sentences.chinese: 弟兄结怨，劝他和好，比取坚固城还难。

sentences.english: If you would make an enemy,lend a man money and ask it of him again.
sentences.chinese: 你若想与人结怨，只须先借钱给他，再向他催讨。

sentences.english: If you would make an enemy, lend a man money and ask it of him again.
sentences.chinese: 你若想与人成仇结怨，只要借钱给人再催还。

sentences.english: That lady was at deep enmity with her neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 这个妇人与邻居结怨甚深。

sentences.english: Never destroy your relationship with people.
sentences.chinese: 记住，永远不要与人结怨。

definition: to start a feud/to become enemies
an old grudge/old scores to settle
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
to not get along well/to be at odds
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
